column4: why does my computer not recongnize wlan0 device but i am connected to wireless?
maybe it's not wlan0?
try "iwconfig"
it has info under eth2
are you sure you typed iwconfig, not ifconfig?
if you did, then you got it, it's called eth2
yes
well i am trying to use airmon-ng and it doesnt seem to work with eth2
is it on monitor mode or managed mode?
on the second line of its info, it should say smth like "Mode:Managed" or "Mode:Monitor"
oh yeah how do i find that out again i believe it is monitor
iwconfig
it says managed
in order to run airmon, you need to be on monitor mode
k how do i change that?
you can start it by typing "airmon-ng start eth2" as far as I remember..
havent installed aircrack on my new comp yet, so I cant test =)
and actually, I'm not sure if this is the right place to discuss aircrack
http://paste.ubuntu.com/413691/
are you using wireless only? I mean, when you are airdumping, you should better not use the same card to connect to the internet. otherwise it will be hopping between channels..
and as I said, it's not really the place for teaching you hacking and all )
